intro: Agelanthus transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal agelanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with suitable climates.
